intro: Corbularia bulbocodium proles conspicua, commonly known as the showy bulbous plant, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that display vibrant colors. The plant features tuberous roots and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically arranged in spikes and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
